reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this light read
reviews.reviewText: Now I have to see the anime. I couldn't put the book down. You are drawn in by the characters and mystery of the Raven Consort and Summer King.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars mystery and ghosts and a budding friendship
reviews.reviewText: This is the first Japanense light novel I've read, and I thouroughly enjoyed it. As a few folks have mentioned, there are a couple of typos. I don't know about you, but this makes me smile because this just means humans worked on it. Besides, even imperfect books have beautiful stories inside. And this is a lovely story, and setting up a world I look forward to exploring more in depth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great book… Love this world
reviews.reviewText: The author has created an amazing world loosely based on Chinese palace rules… But the whole idea of the winner sovereign in the summer or sovereign thing is great. Gives a whole new dimension and depth to the story. Also, like the fact that there’s ghost stories, but not like gory… Just cool, creepy and significant. I’m so excited I have both of these books and if there’s a third one coming out soon. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: So I watched the first season of the anime before I knew this existed. This LN is about half of what was shown in the anime. So I know what’s to come at least a little bit. But I really enjoyed the anime and I enjoyed this book even more. After reading the apothecary diaries and seeing how well the anime did, I must say I’m surprised by how much details were cut out of the anime for this series. There seems to be smaller scenes that happen in this LN that were not included in the anime that don’t necessarily change too much but they were details that I think explained some things so you won’t be confused. But again I really like this. I had to give four stars though because there are a lot of grammar issues. It’s not so bad I can’t read the book but it’s enough where I had to stop and slowly reread certain sentences. I wouldn’t let that stop you from reading because again this is a really good LN, but just a heads up 😁

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars An interesting supernatural mystery at Imperial Court of another world
reviews.reviewText: The Raven Consort is a mysterious figure in the palace life, a 16-year old girl, a consort without night-time duties who can help talk with the dead, deal with ghosts and supposedly even curse others. When the young emperor visits her for the first time to deal with a ghost haunting a jade earring he supposedly found, the two get more involved through that first case, and later because she raised the emperor's interest.The Raven of the Inner Palace is an intriguing low-fantasy story, a romance with several mysteries of a supernatural nature (mostly ghosts) set at the Inner Palace of a Chinese-like Imperial court. The characters are interesting, as are the stories, mostly tied to various tragedies of palace life (including one violent change of a dynasty), but with hints of an overarching story in regards to the nature of the Raven Consort. The pacing is slow though, especially of the romance, and there is always the question about the number of ghosts and why if they are so easy to create, people are not more respectful to those with the talent to deal with them although admittedly most don't pose much of a threat to the living.Still, I found it a very enjoyable read, a book I took up due to the recently aired anime, a good adaptation but the LN does provide some more details and I am looking forward to the translation of future volumes.
Entregado en tiempo y forma. Interesante tema. Ligero y disfrutable.
La storia è molto avvincente, i personaggi e le dinamiche sono molto ben descritte. Ottima la qualità della carta.
